result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Includes cases 22CM336, 22CF523, 22CF631, 21CF1222, 22CF802, and 22CF840. No contact with victim(s): P.L.H., The Store on Stewart Ave, East Town Station and C.D.S.; Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening. No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents. Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept., if not already provided.

Case Called: 10:18 am
INCLUDES 21CF1222, 22TR2037, 22CF523, 22CF631, 22CF802, 22CF840, 22CM336.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Ben Vechinski in person. Defendant appears in custody, in person, pro se. 
VRCW.
Date and time set for a Motion Hearing to address Motion to Withdraw filed by Atty Andrew Morgan, and to address the Defendant's Bond Modification.
Court addresses the Defendant.
Court Grant's Motion and allows Atty Morgan to withdraw from all files.
SPD Office is still in the process of appointing new counsel for the Defendant. 
Parties are to address the Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond at this time. 
Defendant makes arguments. State objects to any bond modification and makes arguments.
COURT addresses the Defendant.
COURT ORDERS:
Amends bond to a $2,500 Signature Bond to cover all files.
All previous conditions are to continue and cover all files- WITH the Amended Added condition of : Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
